alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Northern Dona Ana County; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 4:03PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Otero and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 403 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Northrup Landing, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portions of Jornada Experimental Range and Lake Lucero. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Northern Dona Ana County; Southern Tularosa Basin
